fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-43001].
  {panel}

Hello,

i'd find it quite useful, if there would be the possibility to link JIRA-Boards with Confluence-Pages so you can quickly switch between them.

It's also helpful for all users, because they wouldn't have to search for the Confluence Page, which belongs to the board. They would simply click on the link and get there.

This could be implemented in the configuration of the boards.

For a prototype please have a look at the attachment.
fields.summary: Feature Request: Links on Jira-Boards to Confluence-Pages

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Translated resolution does not appear in the History Tab but it shows correctly in the Issue View screen. Please refer to the screenshot below :

!res1.png|thumbnail!

h3. Environment
(Optional - If Applicable)
* Tested on :
** JIRA 6.3.15 
** JIRA 6.4.2

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to the resolutions page on your JIRA instance 
# Click on Translate resolutions
# Give a resolution a translation
## In my example i gaved the Fixed resolution to translate to FixedXXXXXX
# Create an issue
# Resolve that issue as FixedXXXXXX
# Open history tab and it shows Fixed instead of FixedXXXXXX

h3. Expected Results
FixedXXXXXX

h3. Actual Results
Fixed

h3.Solution / Workaround
* None
fields.summary: Translation of Resolution not working on history tab

fields.description:
doUpgrade method in UpgradeTask takes setupMode flag parameter. Most upgrade tasks that make use of it, assume that when it is true, the database is in the initial state, so upgrade does not have to be run. This is not correct, as during initial setup you can import data, and this flag is also set true. This flag should be renamed and should only be true if upgrade task is run against initial database.

Setting as Critical because it is likely to cause data integrity issues if we continue treating this incorrectly. We've already run into this a few times and it's only luck which has meant a critical problem has not arisen.
fields.summary: Fix setupMode flag in upgrade tasks

fields.summary: Chinese Language pack unavailable

fields.description:
*Steps to reproduce*
* Set user A to be 'inactive'.
* Try to login as user A.
* Observe JIRA will deny login because the user is inactive.
* Click "Can't access your account?".
* Choose "forgot password".
* Enter username.
* Click submit.
* Observe that JIRA confirms "An email has been send with a link to reset your password".
* The user can click on the link in the email and setup a new password.

*Expected Behaviour*
* JIRA should alert the user that a password reset could not be performed or a similar message
* An inactive user should not be able to reset their JIRA password.

*Actual Behaviour*
* JIRA allows an inactive user to reset their password

(i) Note however that JIRA rightly, still denies the inactive user login even after the allowed password reset.
fields.summary: JIRA allows password reset by disabled users
Suggestion to change hyperlink behaviour in JIRA
"Return to Top" or equivalent functionality
Hiding Reports in JIRA

fields.description:
h4.Steps to reproduce the problem:
# Create a new Project A and B.
# Create a new Project Category A.
# Link Project A and B to Project Category A.
# Create a new issue for Project A and B.
# Refresh dashboard and JIRA Activity Stream gadget is showing data.
# When edit the gadget, we will see "No activity was found" message.

Turn on the debugging of the *com.atlassian.streams* package, we will get this stack trace:
{code}
Caused by: java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: duplicate key: 10000
	at com.google.common.base.Preconditions.checkArgument(Preconditions.java:115)
	at com.google.common.collect.RegularImmutableMap.<init>(RegularImmutableMap.java:72)

	at com.google.common.collect.Maps.uniqueIndex(Maps.java:637)
	at com.atlassian.streams.jira.JiraFilterOptionProvider.getProject
{code}

h4.Finding
* JIRA or other application filters will be missing from the JIRA Activity Stream gadget.
fields.summary: Activity Stream gadget fail to load if Project Category have assign more than one projects

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-42979].
  {panel}

In JIRA 6.4.x, another 2 advanced options are made available in Advanced Settings:
!advanced_config.png!

Among these, *jira.bulk.create.max.issues.per.import* is quite important in which it allows admin to specify how many issues can be bulk created at a time or if this feature should be disabled. There're discussions about this at:
* ["Import Issues" function should have additional permission requirements|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-40974]
* [Customer request for more control on user CSV import access|https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/JIM-1414]

*Suggestion*: update [Configuring Advanced Settings|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Configuring+Advanced+Settings] to reflect this

*Note*: [Creating issues using the CSV importer|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Creating+issues+using+the+CSV+importer] may also need to be updated to mention this advanced setting
fields.summary: Update documentation for Configuring Advanced Settings

fields.description:
h4. +Steps to reproduce+
# Go to JIRA Administration -> System -> Services
# Attempt any of the following actions:
#* Click Edit to edit any service
#* Click on any other links to go to another page e.g. Indexing
#* Close the browser tab which is showing the Services page

h4. +Expected behavior+
Users can go to the desired page or close the browser tab without any Browser Alert.

h4. +Actual behavior+
This Alert is always prompted, even though no text is entered into any textbox:
!services.png|thumbnail!

h4. +Notes+
* This happens in Firefox, Chrome, and IE11
* This seems to be related to textbox AutoFocus
* This does not happen in similar pages with textbox AutoFocus e.g. Listeners, Events
fields.summary: Unexpected Browser Alert when editing a Service or escaping Services page

fields.description:
We're using the Jira Automation Plugin and have noted that incorrect results will be returned for hours.

https://bitbucket.org/atlassianlabs/automation/issue/48/transition-rule-stopped-working-on-version

The rules all work correctly in 6.2.7, but have yet to try anything from the 6.4.x series. I have been able to consistently reproduce this issue.

Looking at the how the API is called along with JiraThreadLocals.preCall() and postCall() being utilised, it doesn't appear to be an issue with the Automation Plugin.
fields.summary: Stale Results SearchService API

fields.description:
On of the marketing features for JIRA 6.4 is not enabled by default.
*WORKAROUND*
To enable workflow designer validation
* go to JIRA_URL/secure/admin/SiteDarkFeatures!default.jspa
* enable feature "jira.administration.workflow.validation"
fields.summary: Workflow designer validation is by default disabled in JIRA 6.4

fields.description:
https://docs.atlassian.com/jira/REST/latest/#d2e3218 (GET)

This API has a number of deficiencies:
# internal server error if workflowName is specified that does not exist
# the last modified date comes back in JIRA complete format. I suppose that is ok, but I thought the standard was JSON date format. JIRA complete is more difficult to deal with and I noticed at least 1 instance of data that was *not* in the correct format. At least the date format should be documented
# the output documentation is lacking 
# in the documentation, just under this api is the following link which does not work: *http://example.com:8080/jira/rest/api/2/workflow/api/2/transitions*. Is there an api for transitions?
fields.summary: REST API for workflow needs work

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-42970].
  {panel}

As an admin, I am unable to bulk move all/any time tracking/work logged fields from user A to user B. 

As per:
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/Cloud/Modifying+Multiple+('Bulk')+Issues , Time Tracking fields are not available for bulk editing. 

Suggestion: Add secondary account related database fields for time tracking entries so that if user A leaves the company, user B can inherit pre-existing data so that reporting can be spread across both users.
fields.summary: Ability to Expand on Time Tracking Fields to Allow for Multiple Users

fields.description:
When logging work, a user can restrict it to certain Groups/Roles. However, this restriction will only affect the *Work Log* tab. Users not members of the restricted Groups/Roles can still see the logged work either in the *Time Tracking* section (bottom right of the View Issue page) or in the *All* and *History* tab.

h4. Steps to reproduce
# Log work and restrict it certain Groups/Roles
!3.png|thumbnail!
# Log in as a user *not* member of the groups/roles
 
h4. Expected Results
# This user shouldn't be able to see any information about this log work in all tabs, and also the Time Tracking section

h4. Actual Results
# This user can see that work is being logged in the *Time Tracking* section
!1.png|thumbnail!
# This user can also see the details of the work logged in the *History* tab
# !2.png|thumbnail!

h4. Extent
Other than the fact that this information isn't handled consistently across the entire issue, it also will cause confusion to users on why they can see that work is being logged, but is not being displayed in the *Work Log* tab
fields.summary: Inconsistencies in restricting Work Log to Groups/Roles

fields.description:
h4. +Atlassian Update+
This behavior can be reproduced. However, the root cause is not because of the number of projects or project pages. We have identified the root cause and reported it in JRA-43888. Thus, we're closing this ticket as Tracked Elsewhere. Please follow JRA-43888 for a Workaround.

h4. +Original Description+
bq. The search function when "View(ing) All Projects" does not return the expected result when there are more then one page of projects to start with.

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-42955].
  {panel}

When sending email from System/Send Email, would be good to have default option for email format TEXT, not HTML. 

Each time JIRA administrators broadcasting emails to JIRA users forget selecting the format - HTML is default, so email comes as brick of text, not readable at all.

Default HTML would make sense if "Body" have rich-text-editing controls.
Without them, editing HTML tags is not a good idea.
fields.summary: Default for message type when sending email should be TEXT not HTML.

fields.description:
Email Contains filter on User Picker Form (group members or user type customields) doesn't work as expected.
*Email contains* label suggests that filter results should include records where email contains looked for phrase. Current behaviour seems to use *startWith* method rather than *contains*. I think that this filter should work in the same way as on UserBrowser page.

For example:
We would like to find all users whose emails contain *gmail* phrase.

*Current Result:*
No user is found despite the fact that we have plenty of such users. If we enter beginning of email to *Email Contains* field we will received one record.

*Expected Result*:
All users which emails contain *gmail* phrase should be found.
fields.summary: User Picker Form - Email Contains Filter doesn't work as expected.
created vs resolved gadget is not working

fields.description:
h3. Steps

* Setup JIRA with an incoming create or comment email handler.
* Set up a user with an email address and change its profile so they are notified of their own changes.
* Login as that user.
* Load into jira some custom icon and attach it to priority
* Create an issue that has priority with custom icon in it.
* Check that user's inbox in Thunderbird/MS Outlook. 
* You should see a issue creation notification email and the new priority icon should be in it.
* Reply to this email so that a comment gets added to the JIRA issue.
* Check the JIRA issue in the browser.
* [BUG] A new comment will be added to the issue, and the priority icon will be added as an attachment to it.
 
h3. Root Cause

This is caused because custom images were not tagged with the png metadata that is necessary for any email image sent from JIRA is meant for inclusion as an embedded image in email messages.
possible solutions include:
* try to tag images during configuration step
* change way how images are uploaded for priorities to avatar uploader
fields.summary: Custom priority icons are being attached to JIRA issues upon replies to issue created notifications
NOT operator works not as set negation operator

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-42949].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
When warning users about restricted characters in an attachment filename, JIRA refers to characters that aren't actually in the name.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
(example)
# Create an issue.
# Attempt to attach a file with name "test/test.txt"

h3. Expected Results
An error message warning about {{/}} being a restricted character is displayed.

h3. Actual Results
In the error message, the restricted character is replaced with a colon: 
!Screen Shot 2015-04-20 at 2.42.54 pm.png|thumbnail!

h3.Workaround
Regardless of the content of the error message, remove all restricted characters (as listed in the documentation - [Attaching a File|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Attaching+a+File]): {{'\', '/','\"', '%', ':', '$', '?', '*'}} from the filename.
fields.summary: "Invalid filename" Warning for Attachments Refers to Characters That Are Not in the Filename
Encrypt JIRA attachments

fields.description:
h3. Summary
After upgrading JIRA, the gadgets lose the default columns (issuetype, issuekey, priority, summary) and remain only with the non-default ones configured.
This happens only when the gadget was using the old method for storing the default values ("\-\-Default--" in gadgetuserpreference table, column userprefvalue) 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Have a gadget configured with the old configuration used by the default fields
# Upgrade JIRA

h3. Expected Results
Upgraded JIRA should display all gadgets as they were

h3. Actual Results
Gadgets don't have the default columns displayed anymore

h3.Solution / Workaround
*Workaround 1* 
Manually add the columns back

*Workaround 2* 
Replace the entities file entries containing the old value with the actual column names.
** Original: {noformat}<GadgetUserPreference id="10000" portletconfiguration="10000" userprefkey="columnNames" userprefvalue="--Default--|reporter|customfield_10143" />{noformat}
** Replaced: {noformat}<GadgetUserPreference id="11158" portletconfiguration="10327" userprefkey="columnNames" userprefvalue="issuetype|issuekey|priority|summary|reporter|customfield_10143" />{noformat}

*Workaround 3*
# Run the query in the database  :
{code}select * from gadgetuserpreference where userprefkey = 'columnNames' and userprefvalue like '%--Default--%'{code}
# For all those rows returned, verify the values in the older instance and then update the 'userprefvalue' column with the value from old(pre-upgrade) instance.

*Workaround 4* (if you have an xml backup from the pre-upgrade instance)
# Generate an xml backup from your instance
# Find the parts where the gadgetuserpreference is stored. 
# Replace this part with the part from the older instance.
# Restore the xml backup to the instance
fields.summary: Filter Results gadget's column configuration is lost after upgrade

*Steps to Reproduce:*

# Insert new pseudo values and IDs into the moved_issue_key table.
# Move any issue to another project
# Error page will be displayed to the user, but the error will not be shown in the logs

*Expected Results:*

Error displayed on the user's page should be written to the logs.

*Actual Results:*

Error on error page is not written to the logs.

*Notes:*

Adding appropriate packages to the default logging levels does not write the error into the logs.
fields.summary: Moving an Issue with Duplicate Entry Within 'moved_issue_key' Results in an Error that is not written in the Logs

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-42935].
  {panel}

In JIRA 6.3 Supported Platforms documentation: https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA063/Supported+Platforms has stated this:

bq. This page lists the supported platforms for JIRA 6.3 only. If a particular platform or a particular platform's version is not noted on this page, then we do not support it for JIRA 6.3.

When we run a JIRA 6.3 standalone version (.zip or installer), it's shows Apache Tomcat version {{7.0.47}} instead of {{7.0.55}} (according to the document). 

This information is very confusing and users are not sure which Apache Tomcat version is bundled with JIRA 6.3.
fields.summary: Need update on JIRA 6.3 Supported Platforms documentation
ReplicatedIndexOperation consumes massive space in JIRA data export

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-42932].
  {panel}

Hi team, 

By default a backup service will automatically be configured to run every 12 hours. This will create problems for large installations.

I think we should
#  modify page https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Automating+JIRA+Backups and 
add instruction how this XML backup can be disabled: 
eg: delete *Backup Service*  at _Administration_ > _System_ > _Advanced_ > _Services_
#  modify pages: https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Backing+Up+Data, https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Automating+JIRA+Backups
and add to warning section '_For production use, it is strongly recommended_' additional text that automatic backup should be disabled in that case.

Thanks in advance.
fields.summary: Documentation request: Add to Automating+JIRA+Backups how to disable backup for production

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When viewing an issue in the Service Desk queue, admin is unable to manage watchers. However, doing so from the issue itself is fine.

h3. Environment
* Tested in JIRA 6.4.1
* Service Desk 2.3.5

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install Service Desk in the latest JIRA (at time of writing, 6.4.1)
# In the Service Desk Queue, try to manage the watcher for one of the issues.

h3. Expected Results

The section that allows you to watch users appear

h3. Actual Results
Nothing happens when you try to click on the number of watchers (which should usually allow you to manage the watchers)

!watch1.png|thumbnail!
 
h3. Notes
* Managing voters from the Service Desk Queue is fine
* Does not seem to occur in older versions of JIRA (did not happen in JIRA 6.3.9 when testing)
* Does not seem to be affected by version of Service Desk. In JIRA 6.3.9, tried in both Service Desk 2.3.2 and 2.3.5, but problem does not occur.
fields.summary: Unable to manage watchers from the Service Desk Queue in JIRA 6.4.1

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-42925].
  {panel}

I frequently need the ability to ask a member of my team a question and have the response documented in the Jira thread.consider the following scenario:
  * Bob assigns me Jira issue saying "incorrect number of 'blats' in database".
  * I want to ask Susan, "Please run the following blats query on database and post the result."

I do not want to assign the Jira issue to Susan as iit is my responsibility, and I'm actively working on it as there's other things to research.

Perhaps these questions could be treated as light-weight or non-numbered subtasks. 

Extra bonus would be the ability for the person answering the question to log the amount of time they spent on the question along with the answer.
fields.summary: Ability to ask Questions from within issue -- Light Subtasks?

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-42923].
  {panel}

When releasing a version from the *Project Overview > Releases*, you have the option to set the Release Date. When your language is set to Russian, German, French or Japanese, the date picker for the Release Date is corrupted, as per this screenshot: 
[^DatePickerCorrupt.png]
As per above, all the values are undefined. 

This problem does *not* happen if you are releasing the version when your language is set to English (US or UK) or Spanish. 

This is the only date picker that is affected, the fields in other screens work fine in all languages (e.g. editing issue date fields isn't affected)

h6.Workarounds
- Set language to English in your *User profile* before releasing the version.
- Set the version's release date before clicking the *Release* button. This can be done *Project Administration > Versions* view page: [^ManageVersions.png].
- Release versions from the *Project Administration > Versions* view.
fields.summary: Cannot set version release date due to corrupted date picker when language is set to Russian

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-42915].
  {panel}

I have a security scheme that has "Internal" and "External" levels. I have set one of these to the default. The problem is, the "None" option is still available to the users.

JIRA is able to recognize which Security Levels are available to users, including the "None" option. The problem is that the "None" option will be selected automatically for a user if the default Security Level is not available for them. From what I've read in the documentation, the "None" security level means that everyone can access the issue.

The Screens component of JIRA is intelligent enough to not show the "Security Level" option if there is no Issue Security Scheme set for the project. Unfortunately, the Workflows component is not. If you set "Security Level" as required in a workflow, it will not be disabled for a project that doesn't have a Security Scheme set, thus requiring a copy with a very minor change.

This combination of "features" results in reduced re-usability of screens and workflows and potentially unsafe default options if "None" is allowed to be present with no way to remove it or at least default to a more restrictive option.

One proposed fix would be to allow a way to remove the "None" option on fields without requiring us to set it to "Required" in a workflow.

Another option would be to disregard Security Level as a required field in Workflow Validators when the current project does not have a Issue Security Scheme configured.

Another partial fix could also be to default to any option other than "None" if the default is not available to the user.
fields.summary: Required Field does not work well with "None" option in a Security Scheme

fields.description:
h3. Summary
In *'Create Issue' , 'View Issue' and 'Edit Issue'* , whenever a *duplicated components* are keyed in, and when proceed to perform the changes, there's no suitable error displayed to inform user is trying to create duplicated components. Instead, there are a very general error shown/ the screen flicker and user just unable to create issue without knowing why. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Proceed to Project Administration, define a new component 'COM1'
# Create an issue using the Create Issue Screen, create a new component via the compoenent field : 'com1'
# When you click Submit, screen will only flicker and unable to submit issue
# Edit an issue using Edit Issue Screen, create a new component via in-line editing the component field : 'com1'
# When you choose the 'tick', a general error message will be shown

h3. Expected Results
* A proper error mentioning duplicated component should be shown instead of the general error and flickering without any error message

h3. Actual Results
* The screen flicker once and user unable to create issue 
*OR*
* General message "Communication Breakdown, Close the dialog and press refresh in your browser"

h3.Workaround
* Ensure the components name are not duplicated, case insensitive by checking components in your Project Administration
fields.summary: Components duplicate doesnt throw error

fields.description:
At the end of the file conf/server.xml there is a comment about the log format of atlassian-jira-http-access.log. 

The comment says "The RequestId is a millis_since_epoch plus request number plus number of concurrent users" but the AccessLogRequestInfo code means that it should be: "the minutes since midnight plus the request number plus number of concurrent requests". Which is pretty different

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-42892].
  {panel}

Not all Custom Fields are available for Issue Collectors. There is some logic to certain field types, such as:
{code}
Group Picker (multiple groups)
Group Picker (single group)
User Picker (single user)
User Picker (multiple user)
Project Picker (single project)
{code}
These fields contain information that an unauthenticated user might not be able to see. Other type fields are not available to Issue Collectors:
{code}
Checkboxes
Date Picker
Hidden Job Switch
Job Checkbox
Labels
Select List (single choice)
{code}
However, whenever an Administrator sets up a custom Issue Collector, they choose what fields are available to the Issue Collector. Additionally, sometimes Issue Collectors are being used by authenticated users, as occasionally Issue Collectors are set up in the Announcement Banner for use within the JIRA environment. As JIRA Administrators, they should have carte blanche to decide what fields are in their Issue Collector, and what fields are not, and in turn have all fields available for addition to this tool.
fields.summary: Make all available Custom Fields for an Issue Type available for the Issue Collector

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Stash User Authorized application (OAuth token) page showing old JIRA URL
 * Stash is now known as Bitbucket Server

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Setup JIRA with the URL [http://jira.domain1|http://jira.domain1/]
 # Create OAuth Application Link between JIRA and Stash
 # Allow JIRA user to access Stash data
 # Check Stash user "Authorized applications" page [http://stash.domain:7990/plugins/servlet/oauth/users/access-tokens]
 It is showing Stash server allow JIRA server on jira.domain1 to access Stash data
 # Revoke the access
 # Delete the Application Link
 # Change JIRA server Base URL to [http://jira.domain2|http://jira.domain2/]
 # Access JIRA server with the URL [http://jira.domain2|http://jira.domain2/]
 # Create OAuth Application Link between JIRA and Stash again
 # Allow JIRA user to access Stash data
 # Check Stash user "Authorized applications" page [http://stash.domain:7990/plugins/servlet/oauth/users/access-tokens]
 It is *still* showing Stash server allow JIRA server on jira.domain1 (instead of the new baseURL jira.domain2) to access Stash data

h3. Expected Results

Stash User Authorized application (OAuth token) page should be using the new JIRA URL as shown in the Application Links
h3. Actual Results

Still using the old JIRA URL
h3. Notes

Found out that Stash is getting this OAuth Consumer Description from JIRA server database table "oauthconsumer". 
 Anyway, the Application Link still works fine even though the URL in the description is incorrect
h3. Workaround
 # Backup JIRA database for rollback purposes
 # Shutdown JIRA
 # Edit the table "oauthconsumer" to change the URL and optionally, the name:
{code:sql}
UPDATE oauthconsumer SET consumername='<JIRA_new_name>' WHERE consumername='<JIRA_old_name>'
UPDATE oauthconsumer SET description='Atlassian JIRA at <new_URL>' WHERE description='Atlassian JIRA at <old_URL>'
{code}

 # Restart JIRA
 # Delete both Application Links in Stash and JIRA
 # Recreate the Application Links
fields.summary: JIRA OAuth Consumer Description can't be edited

In the UI, you can see the following
Screenshot from Fisheye
!cruc1.png|thumbnail! !cruc2.png|thumbnail!
Screenshot from JIRA
!jira1.png|thumbnail! !jira2.png|thumbnail!

JIRA should avoid getting into this state in the first place, or at least provide us more data in the logs when we do come across this situation

h4. Cause
The *trustedapp* table in JIRA database is missing the entry for this application

h4. Workaround
# Re-create the application link
# Refer to [this article|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/JIRA+shows+NullPointerException+in+the+Incoming+Authentication] to manually enter the entry to the database
fields.summary: NullPointerException in the Incoming Authentication tab with Trusted Apps link

fields.description:
h3. Summary
A GET request on {{/rest/api/2/reindex}} does not return the status of the reindexing process

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Run Re-Indexing 
# Send a GET request {{/rest/api/2/reindex}} to retrieve information about the reindex

h3. Expected Results
Information about reindex is returned
{code}
{
"progressUrl": "/secure/admin/jira/IndexProgress.jspa?taskId=10007",
"currentProgress": 11,
"currentSubTask": "Currently working on: Issue index",
"type": "BACKGROUND",
"submittedTime": "2015-05-15T10:40:02.657+0800",
"startTime": "2015-05-15T10:40:02.658+0800",
"success": false
}
{code}

h3. Actual Results
The below exception is thrown in the response (Using POSTMAN REST client)
!Postman.png|thumbnail!
 
h3. Notes
Quoted from the [REST API documentation|https://docs.atlassian.com/jira/REST/latest/#d2e4749]: 

{quote}
Returns information on the system reindexes. If a reindex is currently taking place then information about this reindex is returned. If there is no active index task, then returns information about the latest reindex task run, otherwise returns a 404 indicating that no reindex has taken place.
{quote}

h3. Workaround
Use {{/rest/api/2/reindex/progress}} when reindex is progressing. However, this is only available from JIRA 6.4 onwards
fields.summary: GET on /rest/api/2/reindex doesn't return the status of the reindexing

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-42880].
{panel}
h4. +Summary+

It is not possible from a JIRA issue to create a link to a Confluence page if the page title contains a special character e.g. "," (comma) or ":" (colon).

When trying to create the link, JIRA displays the warning message "No Confluence page found with the given URL."

(i) This is different from JRASERVER-44784 in terms of the error thrown.
h4. +Steps to reproduce+
 # Configure JIRA and Confluence to run over SSL and create an Applinks between them
 # Create a Confluence Page with a comma, colon, and/or other special characters in its Title e.g. "Hello, this is a page" or "Hello: This is a page"
 # From JIRA View Issue screen -> More -> Link -> Confluence Page -> search for the above page -> Link

h4. +Expected behavior+

The Page can be linked without problem
h4. +Actual behavior+

(x) The Page can't be linked and JIRA displays the message: _No Confluence page found with the given URL._

From JIRA log, the following error is seen:
{noformat}
2017-04-17 22:31:18,674 http-nio-2768-exec-5 ERROR admin 1351x2439x1 1loq84v 192.168.1.100,192.168.1.100 /secure/LinkConfluencePage.jspa [c.a.j.p.link.confluence.LinkConfluencePage] Invalid response from getting the pageId: OAuth authentication failed: signature_invalid

(!) From the browser's F12 developer tools, the status code is actually 200.
h4. +Note+

If JIRA and Confluence run over HTTP, the same Page (with special characters in its title) can be linked without problem.
h4. +Workaround+
 * Temporarily remove the Special Character from the Page Title before linking, then edit the Page Title to add it back
 * Use JIRA Macros to mention the JIRA Issue in the Confluence Page
 * Use the page link that contains its page ID instead (manually):
 ** Get the link by clicking Options (...) -> Page Information -> change the URL from _...viewinfo.action..._ to _...viewpage.action..._
fields.summary: Cannot link a JIRA issue to a Confluence page (over SSL) when the Page Title contains Comma, Colon, and/or other Special Characters

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-42878].
  {panel}

When integrating JIRA with subversion or git repositories, currently it is only possible to link to JIRA issues by mentioning the JIRA issue key in commit messages/change sets. There are advantages in making this more configurable, such that one could specify some other property e.g. a custom field that could be used for the link other than issue key if necessary.

The use case for this is usually with users migrating from other issue trackers with pre-existing subversion integration. We may be seeing more requests for this e.g.:
* https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/282164/how-to-index-repository-referecing-ids-from-migrated-bugzilla-issues
* https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/174771/how-to-receive-subversion-commits-of-an-imported-project-using-the-external-issue-id

This applies to different methods of integration including JIRA Subversion plugin, Fisheye plugin, DVCS connector etc.
fields.summary: Make links/mappings to repository changeset configurable

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-42873].
  {panel}

We have noticed that at the end of JIRA Express installation there is an screen telling the user he should use his login and password from Atlassian to use JIRA, but this screen does not enforce this information. Besides that it provides a button from which the user can go to JIRA without the need of login. The consequence is after some time, maybe days, the user loses his JIRA section and needs to login again. At this time he does not know the login and password.

We think this could be solved changing the last screen of the setup for me installation in some way that enforces the important information about the login or/and obligating the user to login at first time he goes to JIRA after installed. 

The screenshoots from the setup for me selection and the last installation screen are attached.

Thanks,
Daniel P Santos
fields.summary: After setup installation user does not know his login and password

After linking JIRA with Stash, non-stash users have a warning now that they need to authenticate in order to see the application link data from Stash. Could you please implement a new feature to suppress this message for non-stash users (please refer screenshot below).

That would be very helpful!

Thanks!
